Interface LoopADT

public interface LoopADT

A Loop ADT is a circular sequence of items. A Loop has a current item and the ability to move forward or backwards. A Loop can be modified by removing the current item or by adding an item either before or after the current item.

Method Summary
 void addAfter(ElementType item)
          Adds the given item immediately after the current item.
 void addBefore(ElementType item)
          Adds the given item immediately before the current item.
 void back()
          Moves the current item backwards one item resulting in the item that is immediately before the current item becoming the current item.
 void forward()
          Advances the current item forward one item resulting in the item that is immediately after the current item becoming the current item.
 ElementType getCurrent()
          Returns the current item.
 java.util.Iterator iterator()
          Returns an iterator for this Loop. Rather that using the Iterable interface we'll combine it with the ADT.
 ElementType removeCurrent()
          Removes and returns the current item.
 int size()
          Returns the number of items in this Loop.
 

Method Detail

addBefore

void addBefore(ElementType item)
Adds the given item immediately before the current item. After the new item has been added, the new item becomes the current item.

Parameters:
item - the item to add

addAfter

void addAfter(ElementType item)
Adds the given item immediately after the current item. After the new item has been added, the new item becomes the current item.

Parameters:
item - the item to add

getCurrent

ElementType getCurrent()
Returns the current item. If the Loop is empty, an EmptyLoopException is thrown.

Returns:
the current item
Throws:
EmptyLoopException - if the Loop is empty

removeCurrent

ElementType removeCurrent()
Removes and returns the current item. The item immediately after the removed item then becomes the current item. If the Loop is empty initially, an EmptyLoopException is thrown.

Returns:
the removed item
Throws:
EmptyLoopException - if the Loop is empty

forward

void forward()
Advances the current item forward one item resulting in the item that is immediately after the current item becoming the current item.

back

void back()
Moves the current item backwards one item resulting in the item that is immediately before the current item becoming the current item.

size

int size()
Returns the number of items in this Loop.

Returns:
the number of items in this Loop

iterator

java.util.Iterator iterator()
Returns an iterator for this Loop. Rather that using the Iterable interface we'll combine it with the ADT.

Returns:
an iterator for this Loop
